questions.question: What percentage of the Earth is covered by water?
When did dinosaurs and humans exist at the same time?
questions.resources: Based on the fossil records and carbon dating, the majority of scientists believe there is no evidence that dinosaurs and humans coexisted.  The only possible challenge to this answer would be based on how we define a dinosaur. Things like crocodiles are believed to have lived at the time of dinosaurs and currently coexist with humans.

questions.question: What are the oldest fossils on earth?
What kind of energy does an unlit match hae?
questions.resources: Energy stored in chemical bonds that can be released when a chemical reaction occurs is known as chemical potential energy. This is the source of the heat and light energy released by a burning match.

questions.question: How many ounces are in a pound?
Which is NOT necessary for combustion to occur?
questions.resources: Combustion is a chemical reaction that involves the rapid oxygenation of a fuel source, usually composed of carbon and hydrogen. The reactants of the reaction are oxygen and fuel. The products are carbon dioxide, water and energy. In order for the reaction to begin however, something must provide the activation energy and that is why a heat source is needed.

questions.question: How do mushrooms propagate?
questions.resources: Unlike plants, fungi spread using special single cells known as spores that, when spread, can form new fungi.

questions.question: What is the study of insects called?
What would a sailor measure with a chronometer?
questions.resources: By definition, chronos- is a prefix meaning time and -meter is a suffix meaning measuring instrument.

questions.question: Iodine is used to test what substance in potatoes?
questions.resources: Iodine reacts with amylose, a component of starch, creating a dark blue color. If there is no starch in the potato then the iodine won't react and no dark blue color will show.

questions.question: Who was the first to observe a moon orbiting a planet besides our own?
questions.resources: Using one of the first primitive telescopes, Galileo was able to observe small points of light that appeared to move back and fourth near Jupiter. He determined (correctly) that this must mean that there are 4 objects (now known as Jupiter's Galilean moons) orbiting around Jupiter. This was an important piece of evidence to help people accept that the earth was not the center of the universe.

questions.question: Which country put the first rocket into space?
questions.resources: Germany launched a rocket into space in 1942, 15 years before Sputnik was launched into space.

questions.question: The first personal computer sold in 1981. When was the first freelyprogrammable computer built?
questions.resources: The Z1 was the first ever programmable computer designed and built over 4 years. It was a basic calculator of sorts.

questions.question: Whose scientific principle explains the lift in an airplane wing?
questions.resources: Bernoulli's principle is basically conservation of energy for a fluid. As applied to lift, it describes how a fluid (such as air) moving at a higher speed will have lower pressure than slower moving fluid. Airplane wings are designed to have air move faster over the top and slower underneath. As a result they have higher pressure underneath the wing and lower pressure on top. This pressure difference produces the upward lift force.

questions.question: What element is in the first square of the Periodic Table of the Elements?
What scientist discovered infrared radiation?
questions.resources: In trying to experimentally determine the temperatures of different colors of light, Herschel discovered warm radiation that he could not see, that was always cooler than visible light. This was infrared radiation.

questions.question: Which principle did Antoine Levoisier discover?

choices.answer: The law of conservation of energy
The law of conservation of mass

questions.resources: Lavoisier is a great chemist who did much to broaden our understanding of combustion and the role that oxygen plays in the combustion reaction. In doing so, he also determined the law of conservation of mass in chemical reactions.

questions.question: Which illness is NOT caused by a virus?
questions.resources: Whooping cough is caused by a bacterial infection, not a virus.

questions.question: Which element takes the form of a liquid at normal room temperature?
Which planet has no moon orbiting it?
questions.resources: Mars has 2 moons and Jupiter and Saturn each have over 60 moons.

questions.question: Why do astronauts put Velcro inside their helmets?
Which is not made up of crystals?
What physiological changes happens to astronauts living on the International Space Station?
questions.resources: The lack of gravity allows the vertebrae in the spine to relax and slightly expand, resulting in the astronaut becoming taller.
